poem:
Title: "From Pitch to Plight"

Once a Red, a field-dancing youth, 
swift promise lost in shadows, truth.
Across the goalpost, life did slide,
to corners where dark deals abide.

Sibling ties, a Chapo jest,
fooled by cocaine's sinister crest.
Tangled in this tapestry thread,
fallen star in underworld's bed.

Behind the bars, a tale now shatters,
A boy's dream, in shards and tatters.
